snippet: The government called bombings on its Idlib buildings terrorist attacks, but the opposition said the blasts were staged in an effort to sabotage the cease-fire.
abstract: Syrian government and opposition blame each other for series of attacks against government buildings, including bombings in city of Idlib and rocket assault in Damascus suburb of Douma; assaults, and mutual accusations of subverting the United Nations peace plan, underscore that the cease-fire exists more in name than fact.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The government called bombings on its Idlib buildings terrorist attacks, but the opposition said the blasts were staged in an effort to sabotage the cease-fire.

headline.seo: Amid Truce, Two Sides Cast Blame in Syria Attacks
headline.main: In Syria, Blame Cast by 2 Sides in Attacks
headline.print_headline: In Syria, Blame Cast By 2 Sides In Attacks

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
